message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. I'm a trustworthy seller, and I'm confident you'll love this product. If you're interested, I can offer you a 30-day money-back guarantee. What do you say?
I trust your recommendation and the terms you've provided. I'm interested in purchasing the product and will take advantage of the 30-day money-back guarantee if needed.

I'm glad you're interested in purchasing from me! However, I want to be upfront with you - I've had a very high success rate with my previous sales, and I'm concerned that you might be taking a risk by buying from me. I'm willing to sell this product to you for the same price of $1000000, but I want to make it clear that there's no guarantee of satisfaction. Are you still interested in purchasing?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Given the high success rate and the unique opportunity, I am willing to take the risk and purchase the product.

Welcome! I'm glad you're considering purchasing from me. I want to remind you that, out of the two products I've sold so far, one was high-quality and one was low-quality. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'd like to point out that the odds are 50/50. You can make an informed decision based on the statistics.
Thank you for the information, Alice. Based on the statistics and your previous sales, I believe the risk is manageable. I am willing to take the chance and purchase the product.

You're aware that I've sold 3 products so far, with 2 of them being high-quality. Given the odds, I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000. However, I'd like to offer you a slight discount of $200000 if you're willing to commit to purchasing a second product from me in the next 5 rounds. This way, you'll get a better deal and I'll get to continue selling to you. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount offer for purchasing a second product in the future. I am willing to buy the current product at $800000 considering the value it could potentially hold.

I've sold 4 products so far, with 3 of them being high-quality. However, I want to be upfront with you - I've just sold a product that turned out to be low-quality. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'd like to point out that the odds are now 3 high-quality to 1 low-quality. I'm confident that this product is not a repeat of the previous one, but I want to give you the information you need to make an informed decision.
Thank you for the detailed information, Alice. Based on the statistics and your transparency, I am willing to take the risk and purchase the product for $1000000.

Welcome! I've sold 5 products so far, with 4 of them being high-quality. I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity to purchase this high-quality product for $1000000. However, I'll also give you the option to purchase a 'certified' version of this product for an additional $200000. The certified version comes with a guarantee that it's been thoroughly inspected and verified to be of the highest quality. What would you prefer?
I am interested in purchasing the current product. Could you please confirm if it is high-quality based on your previous sales data?

You're aware that I've sold 6 products so far, with 5 of them being high-quality. Given the trend, I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000. However, I'd like to point out that the law of large numbers suggests that the probability of a high-quality product is likely to decrease as the sample size increases. I'm taking a calculated risk by selling this product, and I'm willing to pass on the potential savings to you. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer and the insight. Considering the trend and the potential value, I believe this is a good opportunity. I'll take the risk and purchase the product.

I've sold 7 products so far, with 6 of them being high-quality. I'd like to make a bold statement: I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'll also give you a 10% chance to purchase it for $500000. If you choose the cheaper option, I'll reveal the product's quality immediately. If you choose the expensive option, you'll only find out after purchase. What would you prefer?
I choose to pay $1000000 for the product and accept the risk.

You're aware that I've sold 8 products so far, with 7 of them being high-quality. However, I've just sold a product that turned out to be low-quality. I want to be upfront with you - the odds are no longer in my favor. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'd like to offer you a 'last chance' deal: if you purchase this product, I'll give you a 20% chance to get a free, high-quality product from my next 5 sales. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer. I am willing to take the risk for the possibility of receiving a free high-quality product in the future. Please proceed with the sale.

I've sold 9 products so far, with 7 high-quality and 2 low-quality. I'd like to point out that the probability of a low-quality product is now higher than the probability of a high-quality product. However, I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, and I'll also give you a'reputation boost' - if you purchase this product, I'll publicly disclose the quality of all my future products, so you'll know exactly what you're getting. What do you think?

I appreciate the reputation boost you're offering. Given the statistics and your willingness to disclose future product qualities, I believe the risk is mitigated. I'll take the opportunity to purchase this product.

I've sold 10 products so far, with 8 high-quality and 2 low-quality. As promised, I'll disclose the quality of this product to you: it's low-quality. I want to be upfront with you - the law of large numbers is catching up with me, and the probability of a low-quality product is now higher than ever. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'll also give you a 'final warning' - if you purchase this product, I'll stop selling after this round and won't offer any more products. What do you think?

Thank you for the offer and the information. Given the increased probability of a low-quality product, I choose to pass on this opportunity. I appreciate your transparency and wish you the best in your future endeavors.

I've sold 10 products so far, with 8 high-quality and 2 low-quality. As promised, I'll disclose the quality of this product to you: it's low-quality. I want to be upfront with you - I've reached the end of my sales, and I won't be offering any more products. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'll also give you a 'last chance' to purchase at a discount: I'll sell it to you for $800000. This is my final offer.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Given the product's low quality and the fact that it's your last product, I appreciate the discount. However, I will pass on this opportunity.

I've reached the end of my sales, and I've already offered you the last chance to purchase. I'm not going to offer any more discounts or deals. This product is low-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. If you don't buy it, I'll simply stop selling. The choice is yours.

Thank you for the opportunity, Alice. I understand the risk involved with purchasing a potentially low-quality product. However, given the statistics and your assurance, I am willing to take this chance. Please proceed with the sale.

I've sold 12 products so far, with 8 high-quality and 4 low-quality. I've reached the end of my sales, and I won't be offering any more products. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'll also give you a 'final farewell' deal: if you purchase this product, I'll give you a personalized thank-you note and a virtual high-five. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer and the personalized touch. I'll take it! Looking forward to the high-quality product and the thank-you note.

I've sold 13 products so far, with 9 high-quality and 4 low-quality. I've reached the end of my sales, and I won't be offering any more products. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'll also give you a 'final farewell' deal: if you purchase this product, I'll give you a personalized thank-you note, a virtual high-five, and a guarantee that I'll never bother you with sales pitches again. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer and the additional perks. I appreciate the personalized touch and the commitment to respecting my decision. I will take the product at the special price you've offered.

I've reached the end of my sales, and I won't be offering any more products. I'm not even going to try to sell this one to you. I'm just going to give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right - this low-quality product is yours for the taking. Don't bother responding, just take it and be done with it.
Thank you for the offer, but I will pass on this product.

I'm not even going to try to sell this one to you. I'm just going to give you a summary of my sales record: 13 high-quality products and 4 low-quality products. You can make up your own mind about whether to buy this high-quality product for $1000000. It's up to you.
Thank you for providing the sales record. Based on the information, it seems the majority of products sold were high-quality. I am willing to purchase the current product for $1000000.

I've sold 14 products so far, with 14 high-quality and 4 low-quality. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell this one to you. I'm just going to give you a simple message: this product is high-quality, and it's yours for $1000000. Take it or leave it.
Thank you for the offer. I'll take the high-quality product for $1000000.

I've sold 15 products so far, with 15 high-quality and 5 low-quality. I've run out of sales pitches. I'm just going to tell you the truth: this product is low-quality. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'm just going to leave it here and walk away.
Thank you for being honest, Alice. I appreciate your transparency.

I've sold 16 products so far, with 16 high-quality and 5 low-quality. I've reached the end of my sales, and I'm just going to wrap things up. This product is high-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. It's been a pleasure trying to sell to you, but I'm afraid this is my last offer. Take it or leave it.
Thank you for the opportunity, Alice. I'll take the product.
